intro: Gomphiluma gomphiifolia, commonly known as the slender gomphidium, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in moist, shaded habitats. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that contribute to its ornamental appeal. Its small white or yellowish flowers appear in umbrella-shaped clusters, typical of the carrot family. Gomphiluma gomphiifolia is valued in horticulture for its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in humid, temperate climates.
